SEARCH
Package Photos71.src.model.accounts

Class Admin

java.lang.Object
Photos71.src.model.accounts.Admin
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Admin extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the administrator of the photo album application with the ability to manage users and regenerate the stock album with default photos.
Author:
Yash Puranik, Joseph Arrigo
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Admin

      public Admin(List<User> users)
      Constructs an Admin instance with a predefined list of users.
      Parameters:
      users - List of existing users to be managed by the admin.

    • Admin

      public Admin()
      Constructs an Admin instance with an empty list of users.

  • Method Details

    • setUsers

      public void setUsers(List<User> users)
      Sets the list of users managed by the admin.
      Parameters:
      users - The new list of users.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String userName)
      Adds a user to the admin's list of users.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the new user.

    • getUsers

      public List<User> getUsers()
      Gets a copy of the list of users managed by the admin to prevent external modification.
      Returns:
      A new list containing the users.

    • getUsernameList

      public List<String> getUsernameList()
      Gets a list of usernames of all users managed by the admin.
      Returns:
      A list of usernames.

    • userExists

      public int userExists(String userName)
      Checks if a user exists in the admin's list of users based on the username.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username to check.
      Returns:
      The index of the user in the list, or -1 if the user does not exist.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String userName)
      Deletes a user from the admin's list based on the username.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user to delete.

    • regenerateStock

      public void regenerateStock()
      Regenerates the stock album with photos from the "data/stock" directory, adding new photos that do not already exist in the album.
